author: reon4778
content: Hi I had a question regarding legacy transactions using metamask. Say Iâ€™m using an older version of meta mask that does not include miner tip. The old version does not include a spot for miner tip so how is the miner tip included? Or does it default to a 1 gwei tip? Or is no tip included only the base fee?

author: reon4778
content: Sorry Iâ€™m new to all this so if there are any resources for this feel free to let me know

author: potuz
content: I suppose the old version will just send a legacy transaction and not an EIP 1559 one. So miner tip will not be part of it

author: pietjepuk
content: A legacy transaction is interpreted as having `max_fee_per_gas` = `max_priority_fee_per_gas` = `gas_price` (<- that last one is the value you set).

author: reon4778
content: Makes sense thank you!

author: reon4778
content: If you happen to have a link to where you found that information I would appreciate that.

author: pietjepuk
content: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1559

author: pietjepuk
content: see `def normalize_transaction`

author: protolambda
content: 218k active validators currently, we need `32*128*64=262144` validators to maintain 64 shards every slot, that seems very close

author: protolambda
content: There is a sharding specification (big update in latest consensus-specs beta release), active development of prototypes (thanks to TXRX/teku team), and work on L2 for sharding (working on compat with execution clients of today), so there are some ideas of how it will look like. Maybe I should write a post about it
